story.title: Initialize Project Repository & Basic Structure
story.i_want: to set up the project repository with a clear structure and initial configuration
story.so_that: all team members can easily access, contribute to, and understand the codebase

acceptance_criteria.criterion: **Given** a new project, **when** the repository is initialized, **then** it contains a `src` directory for source code, a `docs` directory for documentation, and a `tests` directory for automated tests.
**And** a `.gitignore` file is configured to exclude unnecessary files.
**And** a `README.md` file provides basic project information and setup instructions.

tasks.task: Create the `README.md` file with initial content.

doc.title: ibe160 - Product Requirements Document
doc.snippet: This story supports Functional Requirements 5.1 (Clean & Intuitive UI), 5.2 (Web Application Responsiveness), and 5.3 (Core Accessibility Features) by setting up the project to accommodate these aspects from the very beginning.

doc.title: ibe160 - Epic Breakdown
doc.snippet: This story (1.1) is part of Epic 1, establishing the essential infrastructure, security, and project setup required to build, test, and deploy the application.

doc.title: AI Study Buddy - High-Level Architecture
doc.snippet: A well-organized repository is crucial for managing the various components and integrations outlined in the high-level system design. Although this story doesn't directly implement these, it provides the essential foundation.

constraints.constraint: All file paths must be project-relative.
Use `git init` and standard project scaffolding for repository initialization.
Consider adding a `devcontainer` configuration to standardize the development environment.

tests.standards: Automated tests should be placed in the `tests` directory.

ideas.idea: Verify the existence of `src`, `docs`, and `tests` directories.
Verify `.gitignore` exists and excludes specified files.
Verify `README.md` exists and contains basic project information.
